status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

   Thanks for opening a pull request!
   
   If this is not a [minor PR](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#Minor-Fixes). Could you open an issue for this pull request on JIRA? https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW
   
   Opening JIRAs ahead of time contributes to the [Openness](http://theapacheway.com/open/#:~:text=Openness%20allows%20new%20users%20the,must%20happen%20in%20the%20open.) of the Apache Arrow project.
   
   Then could you also rename pull request title in the following format?
   
       ARROW-${JIRA_ID}: [${COMPONENT}] ${SUMMARY}
   
   or
   
       MINOR: [${COMPONENT}] ${SUMMARY}
   
   See also:
   
     * [Other pull requests](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pulls/)
     * [Contribution Guidelines - How to contribute patches](https://arrow.apache.org/docs/developers/contributing.html#how-to-contribute-patches)

assignUser commented on PR #14099:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14099#issuecomment-1244134081

   This PR is possible as the gh runner app is no available natively for apple arm64. This PR also removes now superflous `arch -arm64` calls.

fields.summary: [CI][R] Implement CI on Apple M1 for R

comments.body: I know this is probably on the list already, but one of the things I would love is the ability to install nightly binaries for M1!
[~paleolimbot] I'll keep an I on it during ARROW-16400 :)

This is currently blocked due to the github actions runner not supporting M1 natively. Using rosetta and {{arch -arm64}} is a mess for R so we have to wait until M1 support is released. There is already a pre-release version so it should be there soon (~end of Q2?)
